alert.note: Alert for Eastern Dutchess; Eastern Ulster; Western Dutchess; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 19 at 8:12PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Ulster and Dutchess Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 812 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Kerhonkson to near Gardnertown to near Chester. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Marlboro around 820 PM EDT. Poughkeepsie, Wappingers Falls, Fishkill, Tillson and Myers Corner around 825 PM EDT. Hurley, Hopewell Junction and Red Oaks Mill around 830 PM EDT. Kingston, Beacon, Hyde Park, Staatsburg and Port Ewen around 835 PM EDT. Rhinebeck around 840 PM EDT. Wingdale and Stanfordville around 850 PM EDT. Dover Plains around 855 PM EDT. Pawling, Amenia, Pine Plains and Millerton around 900 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Norrie Heights, Maple Hill, Atwood, Lithgow, Hoxie Corner, Elting Corners, South Amenia, Pleasant Ridge, Washington Hollow and Jackson Corners. This includes Interstate 87 near exit 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Dutchess; Eastern Ulster; Western Dutchess; Western Ulster
